update.description:
Added test for `servicesim/new_task`,  checks if the response of the service is as desired, i.e:

* pick_up_location: "FrontElevator"

* drop_off_location:"PrivateCubicle_32_1"

* guest_name: "human_86138"

*  and checks if the service call is disabled after the first call. 

run the tests `catkin_make_isolated --catkin-make-args run_tests -j1` , has to be run with flag `-j1` because the gazebo server started in one test interferes with the other tests.
update.title: Added rostest for testing /servicesim/new_task calls

content.raw: Yeah, I was making the test pass at all cost I guess :)
content.html: Yeah, I was making the test pass at all cost I guess :)

content.raw:
Yeah I think I never got a test failure at that point. In general, such a situation would be a test expectation, for example:

`EXPECT_TRUE(pickup_flag && spawn_robot_flag && spawn_guest_flag)`

We want the test to fail if the drop off fails ;)
content.html:
Yeah I think I never got a test failure at that point. In general, such a situation would be a test expectation, for example:

EXPECT_TRUE(pickup_flag && spawn_robot_flag && spawn_guest_flag)

We want the test to fail if the drop off fails ;)

content.raw: I had that if (pickup_flag && spawn_robot_flag && spawn_guest_flag) because the dropoff has been failing, did the dropoff work properly for you after removing that?
content.html: I had that if (pickup_flag && spawn_robot_flag && spawn_guest_flag) because the dropoff has been failing, did the dropoff work properly for you after removing that?

content.raw:
Did some small tweaks on  bd04822:

* Renamed `spawn` to `move`, spawn gives the impression that a new model is being inserted
* Added a `robot_name` constant
* Removed `if (pickup_flag && spawn_robot_flag && spawn_guest_flag)`, because I think we should always check that block, and be notified it it fails
* Added  a "timeout" with `while(!spawn && sleep < maxSleep)`, in case the moving fails we don't want to block forever
* The rest is just adding some new lines

Great job! I really like the convenience functions to call the services and move models around :) It would be cool to have a collection of such functions in a "test suite" of sorts.

I'll just wait for CI and then merge.
content.html:
Did some small tweaks on bd04822:

  • Renamed spawn to move, spawn gives the impression that a new model is being inserted
  • Added a robot_name constant
  • Removed if (pickup_flag && spawn_robot_flag && spawn_guest_flag), because I think we should always check that block, and be notified it it fails
  • Added a "timeout" with while(!spawn && sleep < maxSleep), in case the moving fails we don't want to block forever
  • The rest is just adding some new lines

Great job! I really like the convenience functions to call the services and move models around :) It would be cool to have a collection of such functions in a "test suite" of sorts.

I'll just wait for CI and then merge.

content.raw: We could also just put everything in the same test... But let's leave it as it is for now, it's easy to read
content.html: We could also just put everything in the same test... But let's leave it as it is for now, it's easy to read

content.raw: Yeah makes sense, but we will need to make multiple tests  with redundant code. I thought having like this will point out to a particular task directly.
content.html: Yeah makes sense, but we will need to make multiple tests with redundant code. I thought having like this will point out to a particular task directly.

content.raw: The tests are broken into various test cases but they build on top of each other. Usually it's a good idea to have test cases be independent from each other so someone can just run one of them and it works. But we can leave as it is for now.
content.html: The tests are broken into various test cases but they build on top of each other. Usually it's a good idea to have test cases be independent from each other so someone can just run one of them and it works. But we can leave as it is for now.

content.raw: The `ServiceSimTasksTest` class provides several convenient variables and functions, but putting them all in the same class is a bit misleading since there isn't really any shared logic between them. One alternative would be to just put everything in the global space, maybe under a namespace. This would also remove the need to create a `test_obj` each time.
content.html: The ServiceSimTasksTest class provides several convenient variables and functions, but putting them all in the same class is a bit misleading since there isn't really any shared logic between them. One alternative would be to just put everything in the global space, maybe under a namespace. This would also remove the need to create a test_obj each time.

content.raw: Nice, thanks!
content.html: Nice, thanks!

content.html: @chapulina I've added the new service, servicesim/task_info and made corresponding changes in completion plugin as well as updated the tests

content.raw: @chapulina I've removed the previous new_tasks test, moved it into new test, servicesim_tasks_test which will now test all the tasks together, starting from new_task, pickup_guest, drop_off_guest and return_to_start all. Modified some parts taking suggestions from your comments. Also included some tricks, where we expect it to fail like starting the new_task again, trying to pickup when the guest is far away, drop off the guest at the initial pickup location. Let me know if it is working fine. Thanks!
content.html: @chapulina I've removed the previous new_tasks test, moved it into new test, servicesim_tasks_test which will now test all the tasks together, starting from new_task, pickup_guest, drop_off_guest and return_to_start all. Modified some parts taking suggestions from your comments. Also included some tricks, where we expect it to fail like starting the new_task again, trying to pickup when the guest is far away, drop off the guest at the initial pickup location. Let me know if it is working fine. Thanks!

content.raw: yeah that's a good idea, then It might work without the need of check for count. I'll try that and let you know.
content.html: yeah that's a good idea, then It might work without the need of check for count. I'll try that and let you know.

content.raw: Oh yes, I forgot to modify that to use absolute difference, and I have included count in this case to make sure the robot is still there at the pickup location after the iterations. approximately after 15*0.3 = 4.5 sec, The tests were failing if I hadn't included the count condition too.
content.html: Oh yes, I forgot to modify that to use absolute difference, and I have included count in this case to make sure the robot is still there at the pickup location after the iterations. approximately after 15*0.3 = 4.5 sec, The tests were failing if I hadn't included the count condition too.

content.raw: Actually, is there a need to check count here? Isn't it enough on line 85?
content.html: Actually, is there a need to check count here? Isn't it enough on line 85?

content.raw: How about inside this block we just set `spawn_flag = true`, so it leaves the loop. Then after the loop we check `EXPECT_TRUE(spawn_flag)` and then make the pick-up call.
content.html: How about inside this block we just set spawn_flag = true, so it leaves the loop. Then after the loop we check EXPECT_TRUE(spawn_flag) and then make the pick-up call.

content.raw: Yeah , I'm making changes to the file with the updated function definitions will remove this in it.
content.html: Yeah , I'm making changes to the file with the updated function definitions will remove this in it.

content.raw:
We should take the absolute value of the difference.

Also, we could short-circuit this earlier if we change to `(<all position comparisons>) || count > 15`
content.html:
We should take the absolute value of the difference.

Also, we could short-circuit this earlier if we change to (<all position comparisons>) || count > 15

content.raw: Could you fix the indentation here? Thanks!
content.html: Could you fix the indentation here? Thanks!

content.raw: We're not using the room info we get anymore, right? How about verifying that it matches the values on the world file?
content.html: We're not using the room info we get anymore, right? How about verifying that it matches the values on the world file?
